p: The results of the present study showed higher protein efficiency ratio for black seed supplemented rohu at each sampling day. In agreement with present study results, Oreochromis niloticus fed black seed meal supplemented diets showed higher protein efficiency ratio [ 47]. The results of the present study also demonstrated that inclusion of black seed in rohu diets has not altered its hepatosomatic index. Likewise, the hepatosomatic index of Salmo caspius fed with 3% garlic supplemented diet remained unchanged [ 48]. In the present study, muscle protein contents were increased for rohu fed with black seed supplemented diets. The body composition of Oncorhynchus mykiss fed on diets supplemented with black seed oil (1 and 1.3%) demonstrated increased protein contents, thus improving its nutritional value [ 45]. These results are concomitant with our findings. Dicentrarchus labrax fed with 1% Thymus vulgaris supplemented diet has showed higher protein contents in its fillets [ 38]. Black seeds are a rich source of several essential amino acids (methionine, threonine, lysine, arginine, glutamic acid, leucine, tyrosine and proline) and (16–19.9%) proteins [ 49] (pp. 1314–1315). Thus, their inclusion in the diet has improved the muscles protein contents in rohu.
